page.title: 06HOUSING
page.content: Housing The population of Basing Village live in mostly private housing estates, totalling many hundreds of houses. The population is approximately 7000.The village contains housing dating from the 17th century.They are mostly built of locally made narrow red bricks and have tiled roofs and gabled ends. Some of the cottages are of half timber and brick construction with thatched roofs. The Popley and Oakridge areas are composed of large estates of council housing.The majority of units are three bedroomed houses but all estates have a small proportion of lower rise flats, maisonettes and larger four bedroomed houses.The housing is constructed using traditional methods.This area contains roughly 3000 houses built since 1965.
